subtitle: A filling savoury meal that may be served hot or cold.

method.text: Boil the soaked beans in plenty of unsalted water for 40-45 min, until soft. Drain and rinse.

Put the parsnips into a pan with just enough water to cover. Boil until soft. Stir in the lentils, onion, stock cubes, chives and beans. Boil, covered, for 15 min, until the lentils have absorbed the water. Season. Allow to cool.

Sift the flour into a bowl and rub in the butter. Using a fork, slowly add enough water to bind to a dough. Roll out  the pastry and line a 23 cm x 18cm tin. Prick with a fork and bake for 10 min. Roll out any leftover pastry and cut into strips to top the pie.
Fill the pastry case with the bean mixture and cover with cheese. Lay a lattice of pastry over the top. Bake for 20-30 min until golden. Serve hot or cold.

title: Red Leicester, parsnip and black-eyed bean bake
